alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 2:18PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A broken line of thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Camden, northwestern Pasquotank, and northeastern Gates Counties, the City of Chesapeake, the southern City of Portsmouth, the City of Suffolk and the west central City of Virginia Beach through 300 PM EDT... At 216 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a broken line of thunderstorms over Suffolk, or near Downtown Suffolk, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Downtown Suffolk around 220 PM EDT. Bowers Hill around 250 PM EDT. Deep Creek and Great Bridge around 300 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include South Norfolk, Portlock, Mount Pleasant, Lummis, Savage, Suffolk Airport, Drum Hill, Hazelton, Herberts Corner and Saunders. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; Virginia Beach
